intro: Kickxia, commonly known as the "buttercup grass," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Amaryllidaceae. It consists of about 20 species, most of which are native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. The plants typically have basal leaves that are grass-like in appearance, and they produce showy, bell-shaped flowers in shades of white, yellow, or orange. Kickxia species are often found in meadows, woodlands, and along stream banks. They are generally herbaceous perennials with a fibrous root system.
